fields.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.
Customer ID. This is a unique identifier for the Customer

Customer Reference ID. The Customer Reference ID can be used to uniquely identify a Customer.  Unlike Customer ID, Workday will not automatically generate a Customer Reference ID if one is not received.  The recommended use for Customer Reference ID is where Workday is not the source system of the Customer.
Boolean to indicate if customer is used as a worktag only and not a complete customer instance

Submit for Approval is a boolean flag indicating if the Customer is to be submitted or saved in draft mode. If this flag is set, the Customer will be submitted, otherwise the Customer is saved in draft. Default to 1 if the Submit flag does not exist in the request.

Credit Limit is the maximum amount that a customer can keep on account.
Hierarchy Credit Limit is the total amount of credit allowed for the current customer plus all child customers in the hierarchy.
Credit Verification Date is the date that a customer either has or will have their credit status verified.
B® Commercial Credit Score is populated.
B® Composite Risk Score is populated.
Customer Satisfaction Date is the date when Customer Satisfaction Score is populated.
Customer Satisfaction Note is the note for Customer Satisfaction Score.
A flag when set to true, excludes the customer from receiving dunning letter.

Tax ID values for current customer.
Lockbox Reference is a reference to the specific Lockbox for the Customer
Reference to existing Customers to be added as children.  A child Customer can only belong to one parent and a parent can not be self-referencing.
Reference to an existing Customer Security Segment. If segmented security is implemented, this will control who has access to this Customer.

Business Entity Name is the name for the business entity.  Business entities can not be duplicated across different business entity types, ie: a Customer can not have the same name as a Financial Institution unless they share the Business Entity.
Represents the business entity name in phonetic characters. Before using, enable phonetic names in at least one language in the tenant setup.
External Entity ID.  The External Entity ID can be used as a non unique reference to the same Business Entity in an external system.
Text attribute identifying Filename of the Attachment.
Settlement Account Data is the Customer Settlement Account detailed data.
Credit Card Data is the Customer Credit Card Information data.

The reference to the delivery type for customer invoices for the specified customer. The delivery type must be active and is defined by the delivery method. Value is Email, Mail, or Integration when defined by the delivery method.
Options to specify recipients for Email Notifications for Customer Invoices. Can provide zero, one, or more.
The reference to the delivery type for customer statements for the specified customer. The delivery type must be active. Value is Email, Mail, or a configured value defined by the Delivery Method.
The reference to the delivery type for dunning letters for the specified customer. The delivery type must be active. Value is Email, Mail, or a configured value defined by the Delivery Method.
Options to specify recipients for Email Notifications for Dunning Letters. Can provide zero, one, or more.
The date that a customer agrees to receive electronic invoicing.
An identifier for a vendor that offers electronic invoicing transformation and transmission services, e.g. Basware, PAC to tax authority and customers.
A customer identifier issued by the government, e.g. OVT code for electronic invoicing.
A customer identifier assigned by the electronic invoicing vendor.

Tax Status Data includes: Country, Transaction Tax Status, and Withholding Tax Status.

Includes Notes that have been made for a business object. On a Get operation, all existing Notes will be populated. On a Put or Submit operation, any note information on the request will be added as new notes. Existing notes cannot be updated on a Put or Submit request.
Followup Date is the date defined to follow up with customer.  This field is optional and can be entered using related action "Add Note" from Customer.

Customer ID is a unique identifier for a specific Customer. Provided as a criteria to search for customer with matching ID (Ignore Case).
Name of the Customer. Provided as a criteria to search for customers whose name starts with the search string (Ignore Case).

Boolean to indicate whether to search for customers used as basic worktag. If true, include customers used as basic worktag in the result. If false or not provided, exclude all customers used as basic worktag.

Accepted_Currencies_Reference.description: Accepted Currencies Reference. When no accepted currencies are passed in the web service, the bank account will accept all currencies.

Always_Separate_Payments.description: Always Separate Payments is a true/false flag used to indicate is payments should be seperated

Business_Entity_Name.description: Business Entity Name is the name for the business entity.  Business entities can not be duplicated across different business entity types, ie: a Customer can not have the same name as a Financial Institution unless they share the Business Entity.

Business_Entity_Phonetic_Name.description: Represents the business entity name in phonetic characters. Before using, enable phonetic names in at least one language in the tenant setup.

Dunning_Delivery_Type_Reference.description: The reference to the delivery type for dunning letters for the specified customer. The delivery type must be active. Value is Email, Mail, or a configured value defined by the Delivery Method.

Electronic_Invoicing_Government_Issued_C.description: An identifier for a vendor that offers electronic invoicing transformation and transmission services, e.g. Basware, PAC to tax authority and customers.

Electronic_Invoicing_Intermediary_Vendor.description: A customer identifier issued by the government, e.g. OVT code for electronic invoicing.

Electronic_Invoicing_Start_Date.description: The date that a customer agrees to receive electronic invoicing.

Electronic_Invoicing_Vendor_Issued_Custo.description: A customer identifier assigned by the electronic invoicing vendor.

Exempt.description: A flag when set to true, excludes the interest and late fee charges.

Exempt_From_Dunning.description: A flag when set to true, excludes the customer from receiving dunning letter.

External_Entity_ID.description: External Entity ID.  The External Entity ID can be used as a non unique reference to the same Business Entity in an external system.

Filename.description: Text attribute identifying Filename of the Attachment.

Followup_Date.description: Followup Date is the date defined to follow up with customer.  This field is optional and can be entered using related action "Add Note" from Customer.

Hierarchy_Credit_Limit.description: Hierarchy Credit Limit is the total amount of credit allowed for the current customer plus all child customers in the hierarchy.

Note_Data.description: Includes Notes that have been made for a business object. On a Get operation, all existing Notes will be populated. On a Put or Submit operation, any note information on the request will be added as new notes. Existing notes cannot be updated on a Put or Submit request.

Statement_Delivery_Type_Reference.description: The reference to the delivery type for customer statements for the specified customer. The delivery type must be active. Value is Email, Mail, or a configured value defined by the Delivery Method.

Submit.description: Submit for Approval is a boolean flag indicating if the Customer is to be submitted or saved in draft mode. If this flag is set, the Customer will be submitted, otherwise the Customer is saved in draft. Default to 1 if the Submit flag does not exist in the request.
